name: Charleston Place by Orient-Express

reviews.text: I recently returned from a three night stay at Charleston Place. I am going to give as detailed a review as possible in order to answer any questions that someone may have as a prospective guest. I was on a group rate of $299/night, which seemed to be about $100 less than you'd pay off the street. The 3 stars of the rating is based on the cost versus quality.
reviews.title: Good and Bad, But Needs Work to Return to Great

likes.disliked: — The rooms and areas surrounding them need work

reviews.text: Rooms: As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms and hallways are in serious need of an update. The hallways on floor five have wallpaper bubbling up in areas. My room itself was decently sized, and about what I would expect. The furniture and bedding were of good to very good quality and what you would expect from a hotel room of this price range. The bed was a little on the soft side, but extremely comfortable. The air conditioning was very loud and shook quite a bit, but fortunately, it was only about 80F at the hottest during any point of the stay, so it wasn't on much. In terms of in-room amenities, they need to seriously look into WiFi, or at nothing else strengthening the speed of the network during peak hours (right around 5 pm, it seemed to drag). Fortunately, there was not an extra charge to use the wired internet. The TV left much to be desired, as it appeared to be about a 19" Panasonic Tau tube-based TV. It was very high in the armoire and not at a convenient viewing angle from the bed. Also, if you are a PPV or hotel menu based user (for things like room service, checkout, etc), please note that this hotel does not have those abilities, at least not in my room. The bathroom was nicely marble appointed, but there was some mildew in the top corner of the ceiling above the shower and a very slight amount on the curtain. Please note that it is not to the disgusting amount, but just more than you would expect from the "top" hotel in a city.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, Excellent Service
Charleston Place falls short of expectations
reviews.text: Staff: For every bit of disappointment that I had with the room, the staff made up for it in every sense. Every person that I dealt with from the person opening my cab door to the check-in staff to room service and maids were extremely pleasant and polite. I have no doubt that the hotel must do a fantastic job teaching the finer points of customer service, and Charleston being such a nice city overall certainly doesn't hurt. I am not a "high touch" customer by any means - I don't call and complain about little things, nor do I generally stir the pot, so I don't know how they handle complaints. That being said, even the waiters and bartenders, as well as the spa staff were outstanding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities: The pool is extremely nice for what it is (a little small, but nice for the location). I did not use the spa (it was booked up), but I was told by multiple people I spoke with that they did a nice job, though were a little on the high end for pricing. The restaurants were very good, as was room service. Both are higher priced than some of the better surrounding options, but that's to be expected with a high end hotel that you're paying for the convenience. The lobby and shops are impeccable. I though it might be a bit "cheesy" having all of the shops as part of the hotel, but it is very well done.
reviews.title: location is worth it

reviews.text: Conference Facilities: There are a large amount of nice conference facilities. For as high touch as the staff is, they didn't necessarily stay on top of little things without prompting (ice in drinks, clean up, etc). Again, when dealing with the staff, they were very nice, but I'm not sure if the blame lies in staffing (i.e. not enough people to cover the amount of meetings being held) or somewhere else. Overall, they were more than adequate.
reviews.title: Southern gem

reviews.text: Everything you would expect in a hotel that bils itself out as this caliber. Staff was excellent, room was elegant, etc. Need extra towels? Someone will be knocking at your door within moments. A dinner recommendation? The perfect place will be recommended and the dinner reservation made. Graceful, southern charm. The hotel is a little large, but the touch is very personal. The location is perfect. Everything Charleston has to offer is steps away. If you want a honeymoon or romantic weekend away, the risk of a mishap here is miniscule. This place has hospitality down to a science. My only, only very slight criticism (and take this with a grain of salt because the place is very nearly perfect) is that I took advantage of the spa and purchased a massage. Frankly, the massage was only so, so. Could have just been a fluke. It was still incredibly relaxing and the spa experience itself was heavenly.
reviews.title: Close to flawless

likes.liked: — Elegant, great location, amazing staff, beautiful room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love this hotel. Will absolutely insist on staying here again when I return to Charleston. This hotel has all the southern charm and elegance without the inconsistency of its smaller boutique rivals.
reviews.title: Great location, super service, okay room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend recommended this hotel to me as the best in Charleston. My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights. In terms of the location & service, this was indeed the best.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: It is located on the Meeting St. and is walking distance to almost all major restaurants. We rented a car for our entire stay. Would recommend this way if you are planning to go to the plantations & beaches. Otherwise, the local buses will be enough to take you around the historic district, churches, and other major attractions. There are also tons of shops around the hotel, including a dozen of them inside. A big supermarket is about 10 min walk from the hotel, and across the street, there are small coffee shops, candy stores, galleries, etc.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience at the Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: The hotel staff were extremely helpful. The concierge was the best I've ever experienced. The town was getting very crowded on Jul 3rd and 4th, so the concierge has kindly offered to make reservations for us at some good restaurants for dinner.
reviews.title: Great Orient Express Hotel

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING! We will definitely keep going back!

reviews.text: You can't beat the location of this property. The lobby is big and charming and you are steps to dining, drinking and shopping. The city is small so you can walk everywhere pretty quickly. If you get sick of walking take a rickshaw bike - a great way to get back to the hotel at night! Lunch at their Palmetto Cafe tasted great but the service was not good. The sleeping rooms are updated but do not have flat screens. My room had a little balcony that overlooked the street. The property is very large and there are a ton of sleeping rooms and a lot of meeting space - surprising (in a good way) since you are right in the middle of town! The public areas are clean but could use some cosmetic updates.
reviews.title: great spot overall

reviews.text: This is a great hotel, very central for Charleston restaurants and shopping. The hotel resturant is excellent and the bar very welcoming, My wife and I enjoyed our weekend stay and would thoroughly recommend Charleston Place for your stay in Charleston, it is by far the best hotel available.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Close to everything, very good staff, great restaurant with excellent food welcoming bar. Very comfortable room,by far the best hotel experience in Charleston

reviews.text: I spent two midweek nights at Charleston Place on business and had an exceptional time exploring both the city and the region. For the most part, the hotel reinforced my fantastic experience. It’s hard not to fall in love with Charleston Place since it’s so unbelievably well located on King Street in the heart of Downtown Charleston, a place which I found to be the most vibrant historical district of any city in the country.
reviews.title: The Embellishment of a Perfect Place

likes.liked: — Downtown Location, Club Level, Vibrant Energy

reviews.text: I should note that things did not start out on the best foot. I checked in around 11:30 PM and sat in my car in the porte cochere for several minutes with another car in front of me and no valet or bellman in sight. I then got to the front desk and there was no one standing there which was a little strange, even at that hour. It didn’t take long, but two front desk attendants did show up. I got checked in and went up to my room only to find that there was a privacy sign on it. A bit miffed, I came back down and we sorted it out. The whole sorting out process took a little longer than I would’ve expected, but in the end I was upgraded to a club unit on the 8th floor which was much appreciated. When I checked out, I noticed that I had been charged $100 per night for the upgrade, and when I pointed it out the front desk person excused herself, said she would take care of it, went in back, and there I stood for several minutes. I would’ve expected her to be empowered to adjust the bill on the spot, but in the end it was graciously taken care of and I was on my way. The whole check-in, check-out process for me at least didn’t have the seamlessness and distinct thrust of refined hospitality that I would expect from an Orient-Express hotel, but other than that, the rest of my hotel stay went quite smoothly. My guess is that if I had checked in on another day, chances are things would’ve been fine. While I had high expectations going in, no one’s perfect.
reviews.title: Great hotel but needs updating.

reviews.text: What worked
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Charleston Place Hotel. We were in town for a wedding that was taking place at the hotel and everything was perfect! Upon checking in, I asked the front desk staff about upgrading our room since it was also our anniversary weekend. To my surprise, they upgraded us to a junior suite for FREE! The room was gorgeous and huge. It was perfect!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: Charleston in August is extremely hot so my husband and I utilized the pool and sun deck. The pool was so nice and refreshing!
reviews.title: Great place to stay, can be worth the extra money

likes.disliked: — Hot Tub, Steam room, and Sauna being closed.

reviews.text: Everyone we came in contact with was so nice and ready to help in any way possible! The staff went over and above my expectations.
reviews.title: Charleston Place is the Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will certainly be back!
reviews.title: 1st class. loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I (wife and one daughter) recently stayed at Charleston Place Hotel, Club Level for a family vacation, and to celebrate our anniversary. This was our second stay at Charleston Pace Club level, the first being our Honeymoon 5 years ago. We found everything to be great, and just as we remembered it (minus the large bugs in the room that we had during our first stay)
reviews.title: Loved Charleston Place
Convention Center Hotel
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed here in August. We found this property to be substandard. When we pulled up to the hotel we were greeted by bellman on his cell phone. Our car doors were not opened for us and I had to initiate the unloading of my luggage. We were further dissappointed with the quality of the room. This hotel is worn out and it shows. In the future we will select one of the new luxury boutique hotels in the area. We thought the shopping mall and mass amounts of tourist traffic in the lobby to be indicative of a convention style hotel, not a Charleston style experience.

Stayed there in May for 25th anniversary. Staff was warm, friendly and helpful. Great, large room....one of the tvs came upout of a table when you turned it on. Staff brought champagne and strawberries dipped in chocalate to room. Set up wonderful meal at McGrady's. Valets dropped us off in Lincoln town car at restuarant and picked us up. Wonderful place for anniversary getaway. First class hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
Charming and Gracious
reviews.text: This hotel embodies what you think of Charleston. I stayed at Charleston Place while attending a wedding held at the hotel. From the time we arrived, our entire experience was fantastic. We were allowed an early check-in without any questions asked, although we were part of the bridal party. Our room was spacious, clean and very charming. The bathroom was large and stocked with wonderful bath products. The 2 bathrobes in the armoire were a nice touch.

reviews.title: an absolute must
reviews.text: My husband and i are mature retired dedicated travelers both here and abroad. We are fortunate at this time to be able to splurge and realize this is not an option for everyone. That said i cannot say enough about the club level of this hotel. It is a hotel within a hotel, and exclusive. The level of service is non pariel. The ambiance of the lounge and the friendliness of the staff cant be compared. the concierge was fantastic and everything he suggested we did and were more than pleased. No questions were too trivial for a response. We have stayed in Orient Express properties on many ocassions and are very familair with the graciousness of the properties and the staff, but even this was more than we expected. The location of the hotel is also an asset. If you are looking to spend a marvelous time for a very special occasion this hotel and the club level is for you. When you leave you will be planning your return visit.J and J Arlington va.

reviews.title: Wedding
reviews.text: My Fiance and I love this hotel soo much that we are getting married in it! WE walk through it all the time and just fell in love. When we went to find out about having our wedding there the staff was so wonderful. They showed us everything about the hotel and have been so helpful and accomodating in the wedding preparations. We are also staying in the hotel after the wedding. I will write back to let you all know how it went. It is pricy but you are not going to find prices much better downtown and definatly nothing as beautiful!

We love nice hotels, and this was certainly well- reviewed. Went to Charleston for spring break with the kids knowing we were paying a lot and discovered that apparently we're spoiled. Even our 8 year old wasnt thrilled. The location was wonderful, the spa--excellent, the price was not. The decor and staff were not representative of the rate. Perhaps our room was one in need of redecorating, although I think not. All hotel rooms should have duvets, this bed spread seemed to not have been washed in quite a while. The carpet was worn and the bathroom was very Holiday Inn. (sorry)
reviews.title: Getting a Little Tired.

reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening and were quickly checked in by a gracious desk clerk. The room is very nicely decorated in creamy tones, plush carpeting and rich dark wood. The bed had already been turned down for us by the nightly maid service, and we had just started to unpack when my wife notices something odd on the bed.
reviews.title: Would've been perfect . . .

reviews.text: Whaddya know, it's a rotting apple core on the bed comforter. We have no idea what's going on. Is the room already occupied? (Or was it a not so subtle message from southerners to a couple of yankees from the big apple?) I promptly call the front desk to see if indeed somebody is already checked into the room, they apologize profusely and offer to take 100 dollars of that night's stay, as well as move us to a different room. We take them up on the discount, but are satisfied with the room. A member of the cleaning staff appears in 5 minutes with a shrink wrapped comforter to exchange with rotten apple core comforter. Welcome to Charleston Place!
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: Other service notes: Charleston had a water main break that weekend, so the water in Charleston was undrinkable. The management quickly let everybody know with letters slipped under the door that we could drink the bottled water in the rooms for no charge. Although a mini bar to keep that water cool would've been nice.
reviews.title: Big but beautiful

reviews.text: We asked for a late checkout since our flight wasn't leaving until late Sunday night, and they offered to accomodate us free of charge until 3, or we could pay half a day's stay until 6pm. We paid the half day rate which seemed fair enough.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: So here's the summary:
reviews.title: Just fell in love with this hotel and this city
One of the best!
reviews.text: Just got back from three nights at Charleston Place hotel and can say it is everything it was billed to be. The location is excellent (sandwiched between Market, Meeting, and King Streets with entrances to all)and the in-house shops are great. We were fortunate to stay on one of the two concierge floors, which I HIGHLY recommend if possible. On them you will find a lovely lounge filled with complimentary gourmet food and any type of drink all day long until 10 p.m. While in Charleston, we ate at Slightly North of Broad, Peninsula Grill,and Rue de Jean for dinner. All were fairly loud but excellent. Lunches were at Cru (very good but very small) and Sermets Corner on King Street. Service was very bad at Sermets and the food was just okay. I highly recommend taking one of the carriage tours to see Charleston. It was very worthwhile, educational and entertaining. Something negative to keep in mind about Charleston is that cab rides are virtually non-existent. Many places are considered "walking distance" but really aren't. If you must take a cab, plan at least a one hour wait for it to arrive. Finally, avoid Atlanta Hartsfield airport if at all possible if flying to Charleston. Many flights had mechanical problems, gate changes were constant, and the place is a zoo. Try everything you can to go through Cincinnati or other connecting cities.

We stayed here three nights for my son's wedding, and things couldn't have been nicer. The suite was fantastic. Everything from the luxurious sheets to the wonderful view was perfect. The staff was eager to help and offered true Southern hospitality.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it

reviews.text: If you are willing to pay their high prices, you will not be disappointed in what you get for your money. All in all, a great experience.
reviews.title: Mixed reactions

reviews.text: My recent stay at Charleston Place left me with mixed reactions. The hotel is larger than I expected and caters more to the convention audience than I anticipated. As a result, the hotel is fairly sterile and generic overall.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The food on the club level was superb and certainly plentiful. The staff were attentive and helpful but I just didn't feel the property overall came anywhere close to justifying the price.
reviews.title: Southern hospitality at its finest!

description: Historic Charleston’s premier hotel just minutes from famous homes, museums and churches. World-class luxurious accommodations including a full-service European spa; rooftop pool; “The Club,” a private concierge level located on the top two floors; award-winning dining; 28 exclusive boutiques and the legendary Orient-Express service, all in the heart of downtown.
